titleStmt.title: John W. Blee et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Marion Crittenden
County Ky July 11th/64
To His Excellency
Gov. Bramlette

The undersigned petioners would respectfully represent to your Excellency, that a judgment was rendered against D A Flanary in the Crittenden Circuit Court ^at May Term 1864^ on a Bail Bond of Three Hundred Dollars for the appearance of James Oakley on a charge of assault that it was about the time of the breaking out the rebellion and the said Oakley having left the state it was impossible to surrender him to the Said Court under the troublesome State of the country We therefore would request your Excellency to relieve said Flanary from the judgment aforesaid as we think under the circumstances it is one of those cases that demands Executive interference.

Jno W Blue
W E Clifford
Christopher Cook
Thos A Harris
W. D Murphy
J N Clement
J. W. McCallun
W T. Felaneny
S Hodge
Wm Redd
J N Walker
S. L. R Wilson
C. C. Bigham
D Bourland
Robt F Haynes
Alfred Armstrong
A C Gilbert
J C Henson
D N Stinson
William Howerton
Pleasant Vaughn
J A Shewmaker
J N Sutcliff
W S Carnahan
John M Gilbert
Paul. L. H. Walker
amuel H. Wilborn
Thos. L. Dean
W. C. Carnahan
J. C. Elder
F. M. Clement
A. Hodge
M G Gilbert
D P Campbell
